Posts.Content: Just a little humor this morning. I am almost six weeks post op. Down to only a slight dribble, so I am progressing with the continence problem. I own a couple of kilts ( it is a heritage thing). Just had a thought this morning how much more convient it might have been to wear a kilt when I had wear that catheter for two weeks. Just wondering if anyone had tried that or maybe an idea to try it?
Posts.Title: Kilts and cathetersðŸ˜Š

Posts.Content: Underwent DaVinci prostatectomy on 8/1/2017. Just got pathology report. Gleason of 3+4=7. Negative on the perimeters, so we apparently got it all. Now to get rid of this cursed catheter tomorrow. Prayers to everyone going through this "stuff".
Posts.Title: Woohoo!

Posts.Content: Underwent DaVinci prostatectomy on 8/1/2017. Just got pathology report. Gleason of 3+4=7. Negative on the perimeters, so we apparently got it all. Now to get rid of this cursed catheter tomorrow. Prayers to everyone going through this "stuff".
Posts.Title: Woohoo!

Posts.Content: Dribble update. Not running like a leaky faucet as long as I'm not overly active. If/when I am walking I tend drip constantly. Nights are much improved, getting up one time per night to go and very little to no leakage. Any way getting better. Just kills me when I hear guys getting their cath pulled after a week and being pretty much completely continent. But, life goes on.
Posts.Title: Dribble, dribble

Posts.Content: Dribble update. Not running like a leaky faucet as long as I'm not overly active. If/when I am walking I tend drip constantly. Posts.Title: Dribble, dribble

Posts.Content: Finally got my catheter pulled yesterday. 15 days post DaVinci. I could have kissed the nurse that did it for me. Going through man-pads wide open. It seems that I have a steady dribble. I know it is a process, so I will keagle and hang in there. I am so happy to have the cath out that I can actually stand the dribble. I am wondering if having the catheter in for 2 weeks might make it a little more difficult the muscles to tighten up quickly? Any thoughts?
Posts.Title: Dribble, dribble

Posts.Title: Dribble, dribble

Posts.Content: Went back to my uro today. 8 days post DaVinci. Removed my staples, but I got to keep my lovely catherter. My doc said to remove it too soon could have seriously bad effects. If the urethra has not healed well enough it would have to re-inserted in the OR. So I guess I'm waiting another week with this "wonderful" attachment. Just a minor inconvenience but I sure am tired of it.
Posts.Title: Cursed catheter!

Posts.Content: I am very new to all this having just been diagnosed May 1, 2017. It would help us newbie to have acronyms explained i.e. PSA, pretty much everyone knows that one, but there are so many others that I have never seen before. I know that it takes more time, but it would help some of the newer members understand what is being discussed.
Posts.Title: Acronyms

Posts.Content: Came through RP August 1, 2017. Post surgery path negative on the perimeters, so all good. Pretty much not leaking any more,but ....now I am having some problems getting a good flow going. I go on a regular basis, but often I feel like I'm trying to push it through a pinched hose. Anyone had this type problem?
Posts.Title: Pinched "hose"

Posts.Content: Update! Uro inserted a balloon catheter and stretched out what he said was most likely scar tissue. He also said I could self-cath to keep it stretched out. Great to have a good flow back.
Posts.Title: Pinched "hose"

Posts.Content: How many have gone in for post DaVinci physical therapy? What does it involve other than Keagles and walking? I'm already doing that with a passion.
Posts.Title: Post surgery PT?
